input2:
She is with (mainly with visual disturbances from MS) who fell while transferring from toilet to wheelchair.  She attempted to grab the wheel of the wheelchair and it began to roll away and she then fell on her knees and her face.  She has chronic R leg pain related to her polio and her R knee began to hurt.  Her pain was not controlled at home so she came to the ER for help with pain control.   

The patient denies any other symptoms, no weakness of any other extremity, she had dysuria 2 days ago but non since.  No other symptoms, no F/C/NS, no chest pain, no SOB, no LH, no HA, no new visual disturbances or neurologic symptoms, no abd pain, blood in stool.  Rest of ROS is negative.
input3:
- 4 years of RRMS
- Congenital L hip dysplasia- s/p mult surgical repair- 3 total hip replacements, last repair ___ complicated my multiple postoperative dislocations
- Hypertension
- polio affecting the right lower extremity, severe chronic pain-followed by pain service
- Left sciatic neuropathy
input4: Two family members with MS-paternal cousins

Glucose-101* UreaN-12 Creat-0.7 Na-142 K-3.3 Cl-98 HCO3-37* AnGap-___ yoF w/ a h/o MS and polio presents after a mechanical fall with R knee pain.

# Multiple Sclerosis: Patient was continued on her home medication regimen with improvement in her pain. She worked with physical therapy and will be sent to Rehab to further regain strength and mobility.

# UTI: Uncomplicated, treated w/ cipro x 3d

# HTN: Patient was continued on her home antihypertensives with good control. 

# Anxiety / depression: Patient was continued on her home Klonopine and Venlafaxine

# MRI
The number of central nervous system lesions continues to increase.
